page.title: 13GEORGE MONK---1608_1670
page.content:
Although he has been dead for more than 300 years the influence of{George {Monk}is still felt in his home parish.
Born in{Merton},{George Monk}gave distinguished service as an officer in the Royalist Army during the English Civil War. Following his capture by Parliament he changed sides and was given command of what later became the Regiment of{Coldstream Guards}.In 1660 he was instrumental in the restoration of Charles II to the English throne.
In recognition of{George Monk's origins awards of Coldstream Prizes are made each year to children of{The {Clinton School } at a ceremony first instituted in{Merton }in 1948.
His arms are featured on the club badge of{Merton Football Club}.
